title: Remote Customer Chat Specialist
description:
To be considered for this position fill out the following questionnaire:
https://andresolguin.com/rccs-app 

About Andres Olguin LLC
Andres Olguin LLC is at the forefront of revolutionizing how entrepreneurs and business owners scale their revenue using cutting-edge technology. We specialize in done-for-you course creation and launch services, designed to help experienced entrepreneurs, online business owners, and successful 1-1 coaches unlock additional revenue streams with the power of AI.

We are looking for a passionate Remote Customer Chat Specialist who thrives on connecting with potential clients and having meaningful conversations to identify their needs.

Our company culture thrives on innovation, collaboration, and delivering results. If you’re passionate about engaging with clients, using advanced AI technology to drive business growth, and being part of a fast-paced, forward-thinking team, Andres Olguin LLC offers a fulfilling and impactful work environment.

Remote Customer Chat Specialists provide an exceptional first impression by quickly reaching out and answering online chat requests from customers. You will provide extensive knowledge about specific products and services, and identify consumer wants and needs. All communication with consumers takes place via our web-based live chat console.

Each Chat Specialist is responsible for having dynamic conversations that drive the consumer to want do business with us. Conversations are not scripted and we pride ourselves on creating relationships and hearing the needs of our customers. Chat Specialists need to think quickly and provide a personalized experience for each consumer based on their wants and needs.

Therefore, the ability to multi-task, improvise, and type quickly is a must. Chat Specialists are also responsible for working in teams to meet individual and company benchmarks.

Duties
- Responding to prospects in chat software, social media accounts, and email if needed
- Scheduling a consultation between the prospective client and our Sales Representatives
- Keeping a detailed log of your contacts, including those who were not interested
- Following up with prospective clients who have shown interest in the past
- Open to stepping in to take calls ranging from 15 min calls to actual sales calls when needed

Qualifications
- Must be experienced at navigating website pages and quickly identifying information
- Must have social media experience
- Must have effective written and verbal communication skills
- Ability to multi-task and prioritize quickly
- Detail-oriented and customer-focused
- Possess critical thinking skills
- Adaptable
- Career-oriented and professional
- Experience as a Sales and/or Customer Service Associate is a plus

About You
- You live and breathe sales and customer service
- You love how it feels to help someone
- You are quick on your feet and are comfortable with talking to people
- You want to believe in what you are selling
- You are comfortable working remotely
- Time is your most valued asset and you appreciate the flexibility and work/life balance
- You thrive in a fast-paced environment

Hours
- Full-time/40 hours (Eastern Time working hours required)

Pay
- $4/hour-$6/hour USD plus commission

title: Operations Manager
description:
### **Job Listing: Operating Manager for Afloat NOLA (Luxury Bounce House Rentals)**

**Company:** Afloat NOLA  
**Position:** Operating Manager (Part-Time)  
**Location:** Greater New Orleans Area (Remote/Work from Home option available)  
**Hours:** 6 hours per week (flexible schedule)  
**Compensation:** Competitive hourly rate, commensurate with experience  

---

**About Afloat NOLA:**  
Afloat NOLA is a premium bounce house rental business specializing in **all-white luxury bounce houses** for birthdays, corporate events, and other special occasions in the Greater New Orleans area. We pride ourselves on offering a unique, high-end experience that elevates every event. Our goal is to provide the ultimate luxury bounce house rental service, creating unforgettable moments for our clients.

---

### **Job Overview:**

We are seeking a motivated **Operating Manager** to help us streamline and grow our business. This is a part-time position ideal for someone with experience in digital marketing, website management, and systems optimization. As the Operating Manager, you will be responsible for:

- **Managing Digital Advertising**: Creating and managing **Facebook and Google Ads** campaigns to drive leads and bookings for our bounce house rentals.
- **Website & Booking Platform Optimization**: Overseeing updates and improvements to our website and booking platform to ensure a seamless customer experience.
- **Streamlining Systems**: Designing and implementing systems to automate and simplify the booking process, making it easier for clients to reserve our services and enhancing overall efficiency.

This role will start at **approximately 6 hours per week** and offers the flexibility to work from home. If successful, there may be an opportunity to expand the role as the business grows.

---

### **Key Responsibilities:**

- **Facebook & Google Ads Management**: 
  - Develop, execute, and optimize Facebook and Google Ads campaigns to drive leads and conversions.
  - Track and analyze ad performance, adjusting strategies as needed to maximize results.

- **Website & Booking Platform Management**:
  - Reconfigure and optimize our website for better user experience and conversions.
  - Ensure our booking platform is intuitive, user-friendly, and fully integrated with our marketing efforts.

- **Process Improvement & Systems Optimization**:
  - Create and implement systems that streamline our booking process for clients, reducing friction and increasing customer satisfaction.
  - Automate aspects of the booking and follow-up process, ensuring smooth operations and consistent customer communication.

- **Reporting & Analytics**:
  - Provide regular updates on campaign performance, website traffic, and booking conversion rates.
  - Use data to drive decisions and continuously improve marketing and operational strategies.

---

### **Qualifications:**

- Proven experience in **Facebook and Google Ads** management (preferably for local businesses or event-related services).
- Strong understanding of **website management and optimization**, including experience with booking platforms, landing pages, and user experience (UX).
- **Tech-savvy** and able to quickly learn new software tools (experience with platforms like **Wix**, **Squarespace**, **Bookeo**, or **Upgrade to see actual info** is a plus).
- Strong **organizational skills** and ability to create and optimize processes for efficiency.
- Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a remote, part-time role.
- **Excellent communication skills**, with the ability to collaborate with a small team.

---

### **Preferred Experience:**

- Experience working in **event planning** or **party rentals** (a plus, but not required).
- Knowledge of **local SEO** and how it can improve lead generation for a service-based business.
- Familiarity with **email marketing** tools and automation (Mailchimp, etc.).

---

### **Why Join Us?**

- **Flexibility**: Set your own hours and work remotely. The position requires no more than **6 hours a week**, with potential for additional hours as the business grows.
- **Opportunity for Growth**: As the business grows, there may be an opportunity for you to take on more responsibilities and increase your involvement.
- **Impact**: Your work will directly influence the growth of our business and the success of our clients’ events, helping to build a brand that is synonymous with luxury, quality, and exceptional service.

---


### **Afloat NOLA is an Equal Opportunity Employer.**  
We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Web Developer that can take an idea and turn it into a website
description:
Are you a self-starter with a passion for web development? Do you want to be part of a company that values your growth and rewards your dedication? Look no further, as we are seeking a talented and driven Web Developer to join our team and contribute to our company's expansion!

Key Responsibilities:
Primary focus on web development, particularly in WordPress.
You will follow instructions for designing websites in WordPress and have the ability to customise themes as per client requests.
Where the instructions leave gaps, you will do your best to find your own solutions, benchmarking from current trends in the web design industry.
The more skills and responsibilities you take on, the more you get paid.
Optional additional responsibilities include sales (finding and approaching leads), research, and project management.
Essential skills and experience (that we will test):
• Web Development - not just using page builders but actual knowledge to customise things using CSS or similar
• Ability to customise or create simple plugins
• English language at minimum B2 level
• Strong problem-solving, communication and initiative (not waiting to be told what to do always)
• Desire to learn and expand your skillset (using Google, Chat GPT, GitHub and other resources to teach yourself when there is something that you don't know).
Ideally, we want someone who will eventually become a full-time employee, someone who we can rely on. This is an opportunity where you are limited just by how good you are at your work. You can become a project manager, a salesperson or even a partner. The only requirement is quality work and reliability. Do you know why? Because if you are very good at what you are doing, our business is growing and we don't mind sharing that with whoever is bringing that.

How will we know we are a good match?
First we want to see your portfolio, some links with the websites you have created. We will have a quick interview, followed by one hour paid skills assessment. If this sounds intimidating, don't worry. It will just be putting you in some situations in which you can show us some of your skills (discussed in the interview).

title: WordPress Website Developer
description:
If you’re a technically skilled WordPress Web Developer and want to make an impact with the UK’s leading sales and marketing agency for kitchen businesses, this could be your perfect part-time role.

Inspire KBB has been growing steadily, and we’re ready to take our clients’ marketing to the next level. As a forward-thinking agency, we offer print, digital, and web solutions for these local businesses.

We’re seeking a talented and experienced WordPress Developer to work part-time on website projects for local kitchen design companies across the UK. 

The successful candidate will work in a small, dynamic team where you can make a real impact. You’ll collaborate closely with the Graphic Design team, the Marketing Operations Manager, and other key team members. (We have other employees from the Philippines in the company.)

Key Responsibilities:
• Update, maintain, and enhance WordPress websites, ensuring high performance and functionality.
• Create and implement new features and functionalities across websites.
• Style and structure websites using advanced CSS to ensure responsiveness and cross-browser compatibility.
• Conduct troubleshooting and bug fixing across front-end and back-end issues.
• Optimize website performance, including implementing caching, minimising load times, and improving SEO compliance.
• Integrate third-party APIs.
• Collaborate with the design team to ensure seamless integration of visual elements.

Technical Skills Required:
• Proficiency in PHP: Knowledge of PHP for custom WordPress theme and plugin development
• HTML and CSS: Strong skills, including Flexbox and Grid layouts for responsive design
• [removed] Proficiency in JavaScript, with familiarity with libraries like jQuery; knowledge of React is a bonus
• SQL/MySQL: Familiarity with SQL queries 
• Performance Optimization: Knowledge of techniques for website speed and performance improvement, including caching, lazy loading, and image optimisation
• SEO Best Practices: Understanding of on-page SEO elements and schema markup, with experience implementing SEO plugins like Yoast
• Security Best Practices: Awareness of WordPress security measures, such as hardening WordPress installations, using SSL, managing user roles, and implementing secure coding practices
• Familiarity with WP-CLI (WordPress Command Line Interface): Ability to use WP-CLI 

Preferred Qualifications:
• Graduate-level education (or equivalent) in a related field with a solid technical foundation
• Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud and Figma for integrating design assets
• Experience in a marketing agency or with multi-client projects
• Knowledge of web hosting environments, DNS, and domain management
• Experience with Squarespace website development

Ideal Candidate Attributes:
• High attention to detail, ensuring accurate and high-quality work
• Strong organisational skills and ability to manage multiple projects effectively
• Task-focused attitude, with the drive to complete projects efficiently
• High level of written and spoken English
• Appreciation for interior design is a bonus

Why Join Us:
• Competitive salary: $10 - $20 per hour, based on skills and experience
• Flexible part-time hours – to begin, expect up to 5 hours/week (late afternoon/evening PH time)
• Opportunity to grow within a forward-thinking agency

How to Apply:
• Submit a 150-word cover letter, your CV, and a portfolio of WordPress websites you’ve developed, including any custom themes or plugins

Recruitment Schedule:
• Applications close – 25th November
• Video interview conducted on Zoom – week commencing 2nd December
• Role commences – early December

title: Gym Email and CRM Marketing Specialist
description:
Company: TFC (The Fighting Centre) - Combat Sports Gym, Brisbane, Australia

TFC is a dynamic and rapidly growing combat sports gym based just south of Brisbane, Australia. We're on the lookout for a talented and motivated Email & CRM Marketing Specialist to join our team and take the reins of our marketing and customer support operations.

As part of our growing team, you will play a key role in shaping our customer relationship management (CRM) systems, automating processes, and ensuring a personal touch with our gym members and prospects. You'll work closely with the team in Australia, helping us switch over CRM platforms and ensuring smooth, effective communication with our diverse membership base.

Key Responsibilities:

CRM Management: Help us migrate to a new CRM platform (GoHighLevel), setting up workflows, triggers, and automation to streamline our operations. 
Email & SMS Campaigns: Design, build, and optimize high-converting funnels that engage members and prospects. Regularly monitor and analyze email/SMS performance metrics to ensure optimal engagement.
Customer Support: Manage customer inquiries, resolve issues (e.g., cancellations, suspensions), and maintain our high standard of customer service through email and SMS communication.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Pull reports, analyze trends, and ensure our key metrics are healthy by regularly assessing campaign performance.
Personalized Communications: Ensure all automated messages maintain a personal touch—reviewing and adjusting communications to suit our gym's tone and customer needs.
Collaboration: Work closely with the Australian team, providing feedback and ensuring we’re always in sync when it comes to marketing initiatives and customer support strategies.
What We’re Looking For:

Experience with Funnels & CRM: You must have proven experience building and optimizing funnels that convert, with a solid understanding of CRM, marketing automation, and sales processes.
Proficiency with GoHighLevel & APIs: Experience with GoHighLevel and integrating it with other tools will be essential. You should be comfortable working with APIs and integrating systems to create seamless workflows.
Attention to Detail & Organization: You'll be working independently, so being detail-oriented and organized is a must.
English Proficiency: We require perfect written and spoken English, with the ability to understand Australian slang and banter. You'll need to write and communicate casually and professionally in line with the Australian gym culture.
Strong Analytical Skills: You should be comfortable pulling reports, analyzing data, and making decisions based on key metrics to ensure the success of campaigns.
Problem Solving & Communication: Ability to troubleshoot and explain technical solutions in a simple way to non-technical team members, along with a proactive attitude in handling customer support issues.
Customer-Centric: You should have experience working in customer support, resolving inquiries and maintaining a positive relationship with members, prospects, and clients.
Perks of the Role:

Remote Work: This is a fully remote, offshore position, giving you the flexibility to work from home.
Join a Growing Team: Be part of a fun, fast-paced team that’s passionate about combat sports and providing exceptional service to members.
Career Growth: As we continue to expand, there will be opportunities for professional development and growth within the company.
How to Apply:

If you're ready to bring your expertise to the table and help us elevate our marketing and customer support efforts, we’d love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter detailing your experience and why you’d be a great fit for the role. Be sure to mention your experience with CRM platforms, email marketing, and customer service in your application.

We’re excited to have someone join our team who’s driven, detail-oriented, and eager to make an impact. If you have a passion for marketing, customer support, and working in a dynamic environment, TFC is the place for you!

Apply Now and Join the TFC Team!

title: Back-End Engineer
description:
* Please note - Our recruitment process requires prospective candidates to participate in a technical interview that includes a live coding examination.

Job Description
Back-End Engineer, Remote

We are a self-funded Australian startup created by two entrepreneurs with 20+ years of experience in manufacturing industries, technology and finance. We have grown to a team of 12 staff over the past 2 years. Company culture is extremely important to us, we look forward to building a cohesive team that enjoys working and growing together. We are based in Sydney Australia and are on a mission to help small businesses in a specific niche improve their performance with higher income, time savings and a better future.

We have created a highly innovative ecosystem for a specific type of small business in a growing market with excellent tail winds. Our business combines a SaaS solution designed to solve the business needs of this specific niche market, combined with a robust eCommerce marketplace (including our own manufactured products) and POS portal.

Our business model is the first B2B2C model of its kind in the industry blending wholesale product supply and retail POS with complex payment flows and an advanced booking system. Our roadmap includes a sophisticated dropshipping portal for 3rd party products, and integration of AI into the booking process and ML to uncover the buyer behavior of users and their customers.  

The V1 has been in the market for over 12 months with in excess of 1,000 downloads. We are very close to releasing V2.

About the role
As our 2nd in-house back end engineer you’ll be taking ownership of the back-end applications that were written by an external consulting company and making them our own. You be working with complicated systems and the importance of building to a quality standard, as our platform integrates Stripe, Shopify, Xero, HubSpot, cin7, and databox along with all of our internal systems to provide a unified customer experience.

You’ll be working with 2 x Full stack team members and a QA engineer and your role will span across:
Services that integrate with our payment, inventory and logistics partners
Development of a new drop shipping portal
Build infrastructure and systems that are reliable and easy to maintain
Design and maintain the entire AWS stack
Improve our continuous integration and delivery process
Ensure that our business logic is maintained across a complex web of systems
Software development, testing, and confident deployment to production
Requirements
3+ years of experience as a back-end software engineer
Experienced with agile software development practices
A proven track record of architecting, implementing, deploying, and maintaining software applications
Proficient with backend and service technologies like NodeJS and Python
Proficient with AWS infrastructure and CI/CD workflows
Experience in communicating with customers to collect requirements and describe software features
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Experienced in using Git-based workflows in a team environment
A relationship-builder who is comfortable collaborating and communicating with clients, staff, and partners
We’ll be excited if you
Have experience with user experience principles
Can rapidly prototype and adjust in response to customer feedback
Know how to build a continuous deployment pipeline
Are regularly committing back to the community in open source, event presentations, or mentoring
A continuous learner striving to keep ahead of evolving technologies through professional development
Keen to mentor and grow less experienced team members

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
About Pencil Labs
Pencil Labs is transforming how businesses operate through cutting-edge AI and automation solutions. Our comprehensive suite of services includes autonomous WhatsApp Business chat agents, process automation, document processing and custom AI applications. We've delivered remarkable results across industries:

1. Helped a leading real estate agency achieve 25% increase in lead conversion through AI-powered qualification
2. Transformed a vehicle leasing company's operations with automated contract generation and payment processing
3. Revolutionised a food discovery platform with AI-driven recommendation systems
4. Implemented interactive AI avatars for customer service in the telecommunications sector
5. Streamlined operations for financial services firms through intelligent workflow automation

Our solutions have consistently demonstrated the power of AI to transform businesses, whether it's automating customer service, optimising operations, or creating innovative user experiences.

--

Position Overview
We're looking for a Full Stack Engineer to join our remote team in building next-generation AI-powered software applications. You'll be instrumental in shaping how businesses interact with AI, creating sophisticated automation systems that transform customer experiences.

What You'll Do
1. Design and implement scalable, elegant solutions across the full technology stack
2. Develop and maintain robust database systems using PostgreSQL
3. Collaborate with Product Owners to plan and execute project backlogs efficiently
4. Contribute to technical architecture discussions and propose improvements
5. Create clean, maintainable, and well-documented code
6. Work with cutting-edge AI technologies and large language models
7. Build and integrate sophisticated chatbot solutions & mini-apps
8. Explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

What You'll Need
Technical Skills
1. Strong proficiency in full-stack development (minimally)
- Front-end: HTML, CSS, React.js, Next.js, Nest.js
- Back-end: Python, Django, Flask, Node.js
- Database: PostgreSQL
2. Experience with RESTful APIs and microservices architecture
3. Hands-on experience with large language models (minimally OpenAI, Gemini, Claude)

Core Attributes
1. At least 2 years of software development experience
2. Independent work ethic and excellent time management
3. Clear communication skills in English
4. Patient approach to explaining technical concepts
5. Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
6. Proven problem-solving abilities

Nice to Have
1. Experience with open-source AI models
2. Understanding of agentic workflow principles
3. Knowledge of AI multi-agent/swarm systems
4. AI/ML experience

--

Why You'll Love Working Here
1. Engineering Excellence: We're an engineering-focused company that takes pride in building easy-to-use, high-quality solutions
2. Innovation at Scale: Work with latest AI advancements and see your solutions impact businesses across industries
3. Professional Growth: Opportunity to work with advanced AI systems and shape the future of business automation
4. Quality Focus: Be part of a team that values process excellence, high quality, and aesthetic precision in every product
5. Impact: Your work will directly contribute to transforming how businesses operate and interact with AI
6. Autonomy: Freedom to make meaningful technical decisions and own your development process
7. Remote-First Culture: Fully remote position with a focus on output and impact rather than hours
8. Collaborative Environment: Work alongside passionate technologists who care deeply about creating exceptional products

Your Impact
Join us in creating transformative solutions that:
1. Automate customer service operations, saving businesses hundreds of staff hours while maintaining 24/7 availability
2. Reduce lead qualification time by 25% through intelligent chatbot implementations
3. Cut preparation time for client interactions by up to 60% through automated data processing and summary generation
4. Transform traditional business processes into efficient, AI-driven workflows
5. Build innovative solutions that help businesses scale without proportional increase in operational costs
6. Create seamless, automated experiences that consistently achieve high customer satisfaction rates
7. Implement AI solutions that handle thousands of customer interactions daily while maintaining personalised service quality

Pencil Labs is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Shopify Conversion Rate Expert
description:
Are you a versatile and detail-oriented professional passionate about Shopify e-commerce and revenue optimization? My growing Shopify CRO (conversion rate optimization) agency is looking for a Virtual Assistant to help manage client projects, streamline operations, and support our mission to help Shopify brands scale.

This role requires someone who is proactive, highly organized, and experienced in Shopify backend systems, data analysis, design, and communication. You’ll play a crucial role in ensuring our clients get exceptional service while allowing me to focus on growing the agency.

If you’re someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and enjoys variety in your work, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.

Key Responsibilities
Client & Team Management
- Communicate with developers to execute Shopify store updates and improvements.
- Create task briefs (using Clickup) to delegate to developers. Then sending the final versions to myself for final approval.
- Serve as a liaison between myself and my coding developers to ensure smooth project execution. I will still be handling ALL communication with my clients, so this will be a backend role. 

Data Analysis
- Dive into Shopify reports, Google Analytics, heatmaps, and session recordings to gather actionable insights to grow the Shopify brands. Creating tasks and projects based on these insights. 
- Identify opportunities to improve conversion rates, average order value (AOV), and customer lifetime value (LTV).
- Create A/B split test ideas based on data. Design the split test, then work with the developer on building the split test.

Design Work
- Use Figma to design and mock-up optimized UX/UI new website pages, product pages, and other site elements based on data-driven insights.
- Create visuals in Canva for internal and client use.

Admin Tasks
- Organize and prioritize client requests.
- Compile resources (e.g., links, files) to help developers implement updates.
- Handle various administrative tasks as assigned.

Copywriting
- Write basic e-commerce copy for landing pages, banners, and emails using AI tools like GPT where needed.

Basically, I am looking for someone who understands CRO and Shopify growth to find insights to grow my client accounts. Then, the ability to bring these insights to life. Whether that's creating Figma mockups to send to my developers, or basic tasks to send to developers. I will still assist in the task creation as well with projects of my own that I may send to you to map out and work with the developers to bring them to life on Shopify. 

Requirements
- Technical Skills
- Proficiency in Shopify backend functionality and operations.
- Strong understanding of revenue optimization strategies, including:
   - Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)
   - Average Order Value (AOV) optimization
   - Customer Lifetime Value (LTV) strategies
- Experience with Figma for UX/UI design and website layouts.
- Basic graphic design skills, preferably in Canva.
- Familiarity with tools like Google Analytics, heatmap software, and data analysis tools.

Soft Skills
- Excellent communication and organizational skills.
- Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
- Proactive problem-solving mindset.
- High attention to detail.

Schedule & Availability
- Must be available to work from 7 AM - 3 PM MST (with slight flexibility).
- Comfortable working in a remote team environment.

Why Join Us?
- Work directly with a growing agency that helps e-commerce brands achieve measurable results.
- Opportunity to develop skills in Shopify optimization, UX/UI design, and data-driven marketing.
- Flexible remote work setup with potential for growth within the role.
- Be part of a collaborative and supportive team environment.

How to Apply
Please include the following in your application:

- A short introduction about yourself and your experience with Shopify, CRO, and design.
- Examples of Shopify-related projects you’ve worked on (if applicable). This could be figma's you've built, Shopify stores you've worked with (and what you did for them)
- What skills I listed above that you're best at with the most experience, and what roles you have less experience with (I understand that every skill listed above is quite the ask)
- A brief description of why you’re excited about this role, and why you think you're a good fit. 

We look forward to having you on board!

PS:  I am working on creating SOP's and systems for this role, so the training should be easy to follow once you're onboard.

title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer/DevOps Engineer
description:
About servicePath™
servicePath™ is an innovative provider of commercial software tailored for IT Service Providers, particularly managed services and cloud computing providers.
We manage a medium-sized AWS environment with approximately 50 EC2 instances, CloudFront, ALB, and S3 infrastructure across 4 regions, alongside RavenDB Cloud. Our toolset includes Pulumi for Infrastructure as Code (IaC), New Relic for monitoring, and Octopus Deploy for deployment automation.
We are strong proponents of leveraging Artificial Intelligence (AI) to drive innovation and align with our core value of continuous improvement. AI integration in our workflows enhances productivity, streamlines processes, and elevates our solutions.
To learn more about our corporate values and how AI shapes our approach, visit our website.

Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced and proactive Cloud Infrastructure Engineer/DevOps Engineer to oversee, automate, and manage our environment efficiently.
At servicePath™, we value candidates eager to leverage advanced tools and technologies to enhance performance and efficiency. Our mission is to streamline tasks, maximize productivity, and drive organizational success.

About the Job:
Job Title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer/DevOps Engineer
Department: Engineering
Reports to: CTO
Shift: Day Shift
Position: Open-Ended Contract Role
Location: Philippines (remote)

Key Responsibilities:
• Cloud Infrastructure Management:
Manage and maintain AWS infrastructure, including EC2, ALB, CloudFront, and S3, across multiple regions to ensure optimal performance, high availability, and security.
• Provisioning and Automation:
Utilize Pulumi to create and manage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) solutions for automated provisioning and configuration.
• Monitoring and Optimization:
Monitor system performance using New Relic and proactively resolve issues. Optimize resource usage for cost efficiency and performance.
• Deployment Automation:
Manage and enhance deployment pipelines with Octopus Deploy, ensuring seamless releases aligned with CI/CD best practices.
• Backup and Disaster Recovery:
Develop and implement robust backup and disaster recovery plans to ensure data integrity and business continuity.
• Security Management:
Implement and monitor cloud security best practices, access controls, and compliance with relevant industry standards.
• Collaboration and Support:
Collaborate with development teams to support deployments and resolve infrastructure issues. Offer technical expertise to improve team effectiveness.
• Documentation:
Maintain comprehensive documentation of cloud architecture, operational procedures, and policies to ensure knowledge sharing and continuity.

Key Competencies and Experience:
Minimum Requirements:
• Experience: 5+ years in cloud infrastructure management, preferably within AWS, with expertise in EC2, ALB, CloudFront, and S3.
• Skills: Proficiency in Pulumi (IaC), scripting (Python, Bash), and CI/CD tools like Octopus Deploy.
• Monitoring Tools: Experience with New Relic or similar monitoring tools.
• Database Knowledge: Familiarity with RavenDB Cloud or other NoSQL databases.
• Automation: Proven experience in automating deployment, scaling, and system health checks.
• Certifications: AWS Certified Solutions Architect or AWS Certified DevOps Engineer preferred.
• Soft Skills: Strong problem-solving skills, effective communication, and ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Core Competencies:
• Cloud Infrastructure Management
• Monitoring and Performance Optimization
• Infrastructure as Code (Pulumi)
• Deployment Automation & CI/CD
• Cloud Security Management
• Backup and Disaster Recovery
• Documentation and Knowledge Sharing
• Collaboration and Technical Support
Preferred Experience:
• Knowledge of CRM, CPQ, or Sales Management business systems.
• Understanding of the technology or managed services industries.
• Comprehensive disaster recovery planning.
• Relevant AWS certifications.

Additional Information:
• The role may require on-call support for critical issues or deployments.
• Experience in multi-region architecture and scaling is highly valued.

Compensation and Benefits:
• Competitive salary based on experience.
• Opportunities for professional growth and development.
• Flexible working arrangements.

Equal Opportunity Employer:
At servicePath™, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone is valued and respected. Employment decisions are made based on merit without regard to race, gender, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, disability, or other protected characteristics.

If you are an existing employee interested in this role, submit your resume and reach out to HR for a confidential discussion about the next steps.

Budget:
16K-20K USD per year + Annual Performance Bonus

title: Executive Administrative Assistant
description:
Job Title: Executive Assistant

Location: Remote

Company: LawVisory (Legal and Compliance Law Firm)

Position Type: Full-time

About Us:

LawVisory is a premier legal and compliance law firm providing top-tier advisory services to clients navigating complex legal and regulatory landscapes. We pride ourselves on delivering expert legal counsel with a focus on corporate governance, risk management, and compliance. Our team is dynamic, fast-paced, and highly professional, and we are seeking a skilled Executive Assistant to support our Managing Attorney in managing the high demands of a busy law firm.

Role Overview:

We are looking for an Executive Assistant with a minimum of 5 years of experience in intensive scheduling, email management, and high-level administrative support. This remote role demands exceptional organizational skills, the ability to stay calm under pressure, and a strong sense of initiative. The Executive Assistant will play a crucial role in managing the Managing Attorney schedule, facilitating communication, and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations of the firm.

Key Responsibilities:

- Email & Communication Management:
- Monitor and triage the Managing Attorney's emails, identifying time-sensitive matters and sorting communications for the Managing Attorneys attention versus team or client needs.
- Coordinate meeting requests with clients, business partners, and internal teams, ensuring that meetings are scheduled efficiently and in a timely manner.
- Organize virtual meetings via Zoom, using Microsoft Outlook calendar for scheduling and ensuring all links and meeting details are properly set up.
- Ensure the Managing Attorneys calendar is balanced and free of scheduling conflicts, avoiding back-to-back meetings where possible to allow for necessary breaks and preparation time.
- Travel Coordination & Event Planning:
- Manage all aspects of travel planning, including booking flights, hotels, ground transportation, and preparing detailed itineraries for business trips, conferences, and client meetings.
- Ensure that travel schedules are well-coordinated, and that the Managing Attorney has sufficient time to prepare for events or trips without disruption.
- Handle logistics for attending or speaking at legal and compliance conferences, ensuring seamless execution of travel and accommodation arrangements.
- Document Management & Legal Compliance:
- Oversee the execution of legal documents, engagement agreements, and client contracts using DocuSign, ensuring that all necessary signatures are obtained and processed in a timely manner.
- Ensure that all documents sent and received comply with legal and regulatory standards, keeping the  Managing attorney updated on the status of critical documents.
- Internal Coordination & Team Communication:
- Sort and categorize incoming communications, and direct important updates to the relevant team members via appropriate channels (e.g., Telegram team chats).
- Liaise regularly with the Practice Coordinator to track progress on ongoing legal matters and project updates.
- Liaise with the Head of Marketing on marketing and project updates, providing the Managing Attorney with necessary status reports.
- Follow up on action items and key projects, ensuring that the Managing Attorney is kept informed about developments and milestones.

- Ability to stay organized under pressure and maintain a calm, solution-oriented approach in managing a high-volume schedule.

Why Join Us?

Opportunity for growth and professional development in a fast-paced, legal services environment.
Competitive salary and benefits.

Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience to nvazquez@lawvisory.com. We look forward to learning more about how you can contribute to the success of LawVisory.

title: Call Center Appointment Setters
description:
Call Center Appointment Setters

Performance-Driven Cold Calling Experts Wanted - Earn What You’re Worth!
Do you thrive on making connections, setting appointments, and tackling challenges head-on? Are you a cold-calling pro who’s hungry for results, unafraid of rejection, and ready to make 200+ calls a day without missing a beat? If you’re looking for a full-time, performance-based role that rewards your effort, we want to hear from you.
What We Offer:
Performance-Based Pay: Earn big with no fixed salary. Your income depends entirely on the results you deliver—bonuses for appointments set and demos attended. This is a role where hard work pays off.
Flexible Remote Work: Work from anywhere as long as you have a solid internet connection and can maintain a high call volume.
Thorough Training: We provide in-depth training for the first two weeks. Learn the ropes, follow the process, and get set up for long-term success. After that, it’s all about hitting your numbers.
Supportive Environment: Our No Jerks Policy ensures a positive, goal-oriented atmosphere where everyone is driven to succeed.
Who Should Apply:
Cold Calling Pros: You have proven experience making cold calls, building rapport quickly, and setting up appointments. You understand that success comes from volume and persistence.
Self-Motivated Go-Getters: You don’t need to be chased to make your calls. You’re driven by hunger and ready to do what it takes to achieve your goals.
Resilient & Tenacious: You understand that most prospects will say no, and that doesn’t deter you. Instead, it fuels you to keep going.
Tech-Savvy: Comfortable with CRM tools, sales software, and understanding the basics of SEO and online reviews. If you’re not an expert, we’ll train you on the essentials, but you need to be quick to adapt.
Full-Time Commitment: This is not a side hustle. We’re looking for candidates who are ready to dedicate themselves full-time to mastering our process and hitting their targets consistently.
What We Expect:
200+ Calls Daily: High call volume is the foundation of this role. You should be comfortable with a fast-paced environment.
A Willingness to Learn: The first two weeks require a focused learning period. Follow our process diligently to set yourself up for success.
Top 3% Mindset: We want those who aim to be the best, push through challenges, and have a clear why driving their performance.
About Referrizer:
Referrizer is a leading marketing automation company that helps local businesses improve their online presence, increase reviews, and attract new clients. We use cutting-edge technology to make reputation management easy, so companies can focus on what they do best.

title: Customer Support / Virtual Assistant For Growing Wedding Beauty Co.
description:
ABOUT

This non-graveyard Customer Support / Virtual Assistant position is with a successful and established company in the US, with a premier brand and a long-standing reputation for excellence in our industry (18+ years).

We are seeking a female customer support representative who is exceptionally detail-oriented, hard-working, organized, and proactive to join our high-growth expansion. This role offers significant growth opportunities, including the potential to become an operational partner with substantial profit-sharing bonuses, in addition to high monthly compensation and reimbursement for health benefits. You must be meticulous, a self-starter, tech-savvy, honest, and reliable. This position demands full dedication, with availability for after-hours work when necessary. You must also have a can-do attitude and a desire for long-term growth.


REQUIREMENTS – Read carefully

3+ years of full-time experience as a Customer Support agent (ideally in a fast-paced environment)
2+ years of Virtual Assistant
Availability from 6 am to 4 pm PH time (minimum). Also, available outside of working hours when necessary
Appointment setting skills
Exceptional communication skills with an emphasis on customer support
Fluent in spoken and written English with excellent phone and email communication skills
Excellent problem-solving skills
Organized and meticulous attention to detail
A self-starter, able to follow simple instructions and adapt new tools
Proficiency with Google Calendar, Docs, Sheets, Zoom, ClickUp, CRM, etc
2 most recent professional references and 2 personal references
High regard for integrity, excellence, dedication, continuous learning


BENEFITS

World-class happiness & wellness membership
Healthy and caring work environment for you to thrive
Opportunity to advance into an operational partner
Top compensation: base salary + monthly performance bonus + annual bonus
Paid Philippines holidays
Health benefits reimbursement
13th month bonus


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Customer Support:
• Serve as a main point of contact for client communications, responding to inquiries via emails, texts and/or calls as needed within 24 hours, delivering the BEST client experience. Uphold inbox ZERO daily.
• Appointment setting.
• Create invoices and proposals, managing bookings and payments. Apply appropriate workflow(s)
• Create personalized documents and tailor schedules for projects.
• Anticipating client needs and proactively reaching out when any milestones are coming due.
• Utilize HoneyBook (CRM), Google Calendar, Google Slides, Google Voice with a high level of proficiency to manage project timelines and tasks, ensuring all relevant information is seamlessly integrated in HoneyBook and Asana.
• Monitor urgent matters, be it email or text, at all times

2. Organizational Support:
• Provide comprehensive support to the CEO and team. Handle day-to-day administrative tasks.
• Manage calendars, schedule meetings, and allocate time for various appointments.
• Organize files and documents for easy access and efficiency.
• Monitor and manage project tasks, ensuring accuracy and timely execution.
• Oversee attendance and issue monthly and quarterly rewards.
• Utilize ClickUp to prioritize tasks and manage project deadlines strategically.

3. Sales & Marketing:
• Track leads in systems, maintain appropriate project stages and manage detailed checklists tailored to each project stage.
• Ensure all inquiries are responded to in a timely manner, taking charge of lead follow-up and turning leads into sales.
• Develop and manage automation to boost sales, making necessary changes to increase effectiveness.
• Design promotional newsletter, copywriting, and tracking metrics to advance campaign effectiveness.
• Handle birthday cards, research and purchase gifts for special occasions.
• Utilize platforms such as Flodesk, Paperless Post, Amazon, William Sonoma, etc.

4. Vendor Support:
• Act as a liaison, to facilitate efficient communication with vendors, answering inquiries and assisting with needs, demonstrating exceptional judgment in problem-solving to deliver the best vendor experience
• Manage referral partner bonus points with 100?curacy, issue rewards as needed.
• Create and update a partner's personal reward portal with accurate points monthly.
• Ensure vendor’s personal and professional information is up to date.

5. Project Management:
• Play a central role in project management, ensuring that every client's journey through our service process is meticulously planned and monitored. This involves a detailed understanding of each project's status and the ability to adapt workflows as necessary.
• Coordinate effectively with referral partners and vendors to ensure a seamless integration of services, which requires excellent communication skills and the ability to build rapport and nurture relationships proactively.

6. Professional Development:
• Engage in self-directed learning and proactively participate in training to embody insights of the wedding and the beauty industry.
• Acquire knowledge and required skills as an excellent executive assistant, including familiarity with industry standards and processes.

7. Website/Platform Maintenance:
• Update web pages as needed
• Add new albums to the website, showcasing the latest work
• Manage company profiles on third-party platforms, generating positive reviews


We seek individuals who aren't just seeking a job but a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to evolve into a valued partner within our team. If you meet these high qualifications, start your application: form.typeform.com/to/DIc7hAz7
Type "OJ" after your full name.

We look forward to welcoming you to the Kohnur team!

title: Senior Associate - Accounting and FP&A
description:
About Us:
Profitability Partners is a distinguished fractional CFO business based in Tampa, Florida, specializing in delivering financial expertise to small and medium-sized businesses, e-commerce companies, and startups. We are on the lookout for a highly experienced Senior Accountant and FP&A Analyst with a comprehensive background in audit, general accounting practices and experience with FP&A. This remote, full-time opportunity is ideal for an overseas professional eager to take on a central role in our expansion, with the potential to grow into a managerial position overseeing our accounting operations.

Key Responsibilities:

Month-End and Year-End Closing:

Manage the month-end and year-end close process, ensuring accurate and timely recording of all financial transactions.
Conduct thorough account reconciliations and adjust journal entries to reflect the correct financial position.
Prepare detailed financial reports and statements, analyzing for variances and providing insights on financial status.

General Accounting & Financial Management:
Maintain accurate and comprehensive financial records and general ledgers.
Manage all aspects of bookkeeping, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, invoicing, and payroll.

Financial Planning & Analysis:
Support clients in financial modeling and creating forward-looking cash forecasts to support capital allocation decisions

Data Analysis of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Analyze client operational data and that ties into financial performance. Condense and present data in a manageable, easy to digest format for clients to draw strategic insights from

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance; Master’s degree or MBA preferred.
CPA certification is required.
At least 3 years of GAAP-based accounting experience, with a focus on audit with time spent at a Big 4 accounting firm.
Experience with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, NetSuite, Wave).
Experience as an FP&A analyst or manager and familiarity working with financial models and forward-looking projections
C1 level or higher proficiency in English.
Demonstrated expertise in managing full-cycle accounting and tax filing processes.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
A strong sense of ethics, confidentiality, and professionalism.
Ability to work during U.S. Eastern Standard Time business hours full-time.
Ability to work independently, prioritize effectively, and meet deadlines.

title: Sales Administrator
description:
Cornerstone Information Technologies, LLC

Sales Administrator
Department: Sales
Reports to: Sales Manager / Chief Business Development Officer | Supervises: None

Job Description Overview

The Sales Administrator is a key team member within the Business Development Department who is responsible for supporting the sales team throughout the sales life cycle. These responsibilities include, but are not limited to, opportunity management (creating, maintaining sales opportunities, and converting into quotes), product renewals, new product orders, and all related follow up.

***Note: this is a client/people-facing role.

Knowledge - Education, certifications, courses, training, and experience

Required:
• Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience and skill-based knowledge).
• 3 to 5 min. years of B2B sales experience.
• 1 – 2 years’ experience working with quoting tools.
• Confident understanding of CRM and opportunity management systems.

Preferred:
• ConnectWise (CW) CPQ experience [formerly CW Sell], or (Salesforce, Quote works, etc.).

Capability - Abilities, Skills, and Competencies 

Required:
• Attention to Detail: Ensuring accuracy in all sales-related documentation and processes.
• Organizational Skills: Managing multiple tasks and priorities efficiently (including strong time management).
• Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with sales software and tools (such as CRM systems) and proficient with Microsoft Office Suite.
         o Knowledge of IT (or developing knowledge of IT) products/services and solutions (e.g., Microsoft Exchange, Office 365, Citrix, Cisco, iManage). 
• Customer Service Orientation: Providing excellent service to both internal and external customers. 
• Team Collaboration: Working effectively within a team environment to achieve common goals.
• Communication Skills: Communicate in English at a professional business level (written/oral) with internal members, clients, prospects, and partners/vendors. 
• Self- Motivation: Demonstrate strong self-motivation, apply common sense, and follow through on tasks independently. 
• Initiative-taking, Proactive, Self-Starter: 
        o Identify flaws in processes and take the initiative to remediate them. 
        o Start tasks independently with the ability to manage multiple tasks, projects, and responsibilities. 
• Follow-Through Skills: 
        o Ensure all tasks are completed effectively and efficiently. 
        o Meet Deadlines.
• Professionalism.
• People Skills: Ability to build strong relationships.
• Data entry skills.
• Problem-Solving: Addressing and resolving any issues that arise during the sales process.
• Ability to schedule meetings for work – related purposes and for sales members via phone or email.
• Ability to run meetings, maintain agendas, take notes, and assign action items.

Work – General - Job Roles and Responsibilities 
Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
• Opportunity Management: Creating, maintaining, and converting sales opportunities into quotes. 
• Product Renewals: Managing the renewal process for existing products.
• New Product Orders: Handling orders for new products and ensuring timely follow-up.
• Customer Relationship Management (CRM): Maintaining accurate and up-to-date customer records in the CRM system, as relates to sales.
• Sales Reporting: Generating and analyzing sales reports to support decision-making.
• Administrative Support: Assisting with scheduling, preparing sales documents, and coordinating meetings.
• Communication: Acting as a liaison between the sales team and other departments to ensure smooth operations.
• Support: 
        o Sales Manager/Chief Business Development Officer and sales team. 
        o CEO sales activities. 
• Own the complete quoting process using CW CPQ for all company sales quotes. 
• Administer CW CPQ. 
• Maintain vendor/partner relations.
• Maintain the agenda and take notes for the Weekly Sales Call. 
• Maintain and tailor prospect pitch decks. 
• Create annual budget renewal reports. 
• Create, revise, and send engineering rate letters to clients. 
• Create and maintain deal registrations in partner portals.
• Create, maintain, update, and file sales department documentation. 
• Review and approve product invoices.
• Perform date entry tasks.
• Schedule meetings for their own work-related purposes and for sales team members via phone or email. 
• Run scheduled meetings, maintain agendas, take notes, and assign action items. 
• Outgoing and willing to communicate with clients, prospects and partners / vendor as needed. 

Work – Detail - Job Duties and Tasks (but not limited to)

Quoting in CW CPQ
• Generating quotes for professional services, managed services, and product renewals/subscriptions. 
• Build, modify, finalize, and distribute all company quotes for:
        o Professional Services
        o Managed Services
        o Products (renewals, subscriptions)
• Coordinate with CSAs (Client System Architect) to create, edit, and deliver quotes.
• Process won quotes.
• Must be detail oriented and able to fine tune quotes and finalize by deadlines.

Admin user for CW CPQ 
• Responsible for, but not limited to, the following tasks:
      o Add/delete users.
      o Settings
      o Assist with user troubleshooting.
o Uploading tax codes
o Template formatting

Sales opportunities in CW: 
Creating and maintaining Sales opportunities in ConnectWise.
• Professional Services / Managed Services:
o Create, update/maintain, and close Opps, as needed.
o Convert won opportunities in CW.
o Processing won quotes in CW CPQ (formerly CW Sell). 
• Renewals
o Check CW Renewals Board daily/weekly for upcoming renewals.
o Create, update/maintain, and close Opps, as needed.
o Convert won opportunities as part of procurement process.
• New (hardware/software)
o Create, update/maintain, and close Opps, as needed.
o Tracking product/software versions with internal team for potential upgrade/upsell.
o Convert won opportunities as part of procurement process.
o Closing quotes and POs promptly, maintaining sales call agendas, and updating sales opportunities in CW.

Additional sales related areas in CW
• Manage procurement process with accounting team.
• Review and approve product invoices.
• Maintain/update inventory/configurations catalog.
• Maintain/update product catalog.
• Maintain/update agreements with internal teams.
• Maintain/update renewals board.

Develop and maintain relationships and follow-up with key channel partners, inside sales reps, and vendors.
• Maintaining vendor/partner relations and reviewing product invoices. 
o Participate in regular meetings with Account Reps, Account Managers, Sales Reps, etc.
o Request for sales quotes, as needed.
Generate Sales reports including, but not limited to:
• Annual budget renewal reports.
• Managing engineering rate letters, software/license renewals, and deal registrations in partner portals. 
• Creating/updating client references and handling. 
Update job knowledge by studying new product descriptions and participating in educational opportunities.
• Complete sales exams / certifications as needed, per partner requirements.
• Stay up to date on sales pages on partner websites.
• Attend partner webinars – understand what’s new.

Accomplish department and organization goals.
• By accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to the position.

Maintain quality results.
• By following Cornerstone.IT standards and procedures; making recommendations to improve processes, policies, and procedures within department.

This is a Full-time position. Approx. 40 hours a week.
Type: Cornerstone.IT Full-time Global Resource Consultant 
Travel: 0-25%
Expertise: Quoting: Managed Services, Professional Services, and Products, Sales Administration, Professionalism, Communication, Organization.
Job Type: Full-time Consultant
Location: Remote / Virtual
Years of Experience: 3-5 years +

Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee / global resource encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee / global resource to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

You may submit your resume to HR@Cornerstone.IT. 
http://www.cornerstone.it/about-cornerstone/work-place-careers/

Why Join Our Team: 
Cornerstone offers a variety of benefits including an innovative approach to work using a virtual office. We offer a flexible and friendly work culture so that you can achieve your best and grow. We believe that the work ethic and technical ability of all Cornerstone employees is the foundation of our success as well as our clients. We offer paid training as part of our benefits. Cornerstone.IT attracts top talent and boasts an above industry average employee retention rate.

About Cornerstone: 
Cornerstone.IT, a trusted provider since 2003, offers top-tier Managed IT and Project Services, empowering small to mid-sized law firms nationwide with a competitive edge. We strategically plan, design, implement, and maintain clients’ cloud-based and on-premises systems to optimize IT investments and prioritize security. Our personalized service ensures a robust and secure IT infrastructure for our clients, strictly adhering to NIST 800 171 standards. Our entire operation is ISO 27001 certified. We build IT better!

Wholesale Management

 • Configure and manage wholesale operations in Shopify using apps like Wholesale Helper or Wholesale Club.
 • Set up and enforce pricing tiers, minimum order rules, and customer-specific pricing.
 • Onboard and support wholesale clients, including managing account approvals and responding to inquiries.

Direct-to-Consumer (DTC) Operations

 • Maintain the Shopify storefront, ensuring accurate product listings, pricing, and promotions.
 • Implement basic SEO strategies to improve site visibility and attract organic traffic.

Shipping App Implementation and Optimization

 • Lead the setup and optimization of shipping tools like ShipStation or Pirate Ship, including:
 • Automating shipping rates for both wholesale and DTC orders.
 • Setting up workflows for regional or product-specific shipping rules.
 • Monitoring shipping costs and delivery performance to identify improvements.

Marketplace Management

 • List and manage products on marketplaces like eBay and Etsy.
 • Create and optimize listings for visibility and sales performance.
 • Monitor and adjust marketplace-specific shipping and pricing settings.

Optional (Nice-to-Have): Email Marketing

 • Assist with email marketing campaigns using Klaviyo or Shopify Email, including automation like onboarding sequences, reorder reminders, and promotional emails.

Qualifications

 • Required:
 • Proven experience managing Shopify, including wholesale setups.
 • Expertise with shipping platforms like ShipStation or Pirate Ship.
 • Familiarity with marketplaces such as eBay and Etsy.
 • Basic understanding of SEO for e-commerce platforms.
 • Strong organizational and communication skills.
 • Preferred:
 • Experience in wholesale operations, including onboarding and account management.
 • Knowledge of email marketing platforms like Klaviyo.

What We Offer

 • Hourly Pay: $4–$7 per hour, based on qualifications.
 • Performance bonuses for exceeding expectations.
 • Flexible part-time schedule.
 • Opportunity to work with a growing company in a niche industry.

How to Apply

We value thoughtful and thorough applications. Please email matt@allanglesnetwork.com with the following:
 1. Your updated resume.
 2. A cover letter explaining why you’re a great fit for this role and how your experience aligns with the responsibilities listed.
 3. Answers to the following questions:
 • What experience do you have with Shopify apps for managing wholesale operations?
 • How would you approach setting up and optimizing a shipping platform like ShipStation for both wholesale and retail orders?
 • Have you managed product listings on eBay or Etsy? If so, what strategies did you use to optimize performance?
 • What processes or tools have you used to ensure accurate pricing and inventory management across multiple sales channels?
 • How do you prioritize tasks when managing multiple platforms and responsibilities?

title: Digital Marketing Assistant
description:
Job Title: Digital Marketing Assistant

Job Description:

We are looking for a versatile and detail-oriented Digital Marketing Specialist/Assistant to help manage and optimize digital marketing campaigns, client accounts, and reporting. This role is ideal for someone who can effectively analyze campaign performance, troubleshoot technical issues, and contribute to website and data integration projects. Candidates with a background or interest in IT and technical troubleshooting are highly preferred, as these skills can enhance our team’s efficiency in managing client needs.

Key Responsibilities:
1. Campaign Management & Optimization
    ? Monitor Google and Meta ad campaigns to ensure they meet performance goals and align with strategic objectives.
    ? Provide insights and recommendations to optimize campaigns based on data analysis and industry trends.
2. Client Reporting & Analytics
    ? Compile, analyze, and deliver performance reports, highlighting key metrics and actionable insights.
    ? Maintain data accuracy by setting up and troubleshooting tracking solutions in analytics platforms as needed.
3. Technical Support & Troubleshooting
    ? Respond to client inquiries related to campaign performance, website functionality, and analytics.
    ? Address and resolve technical issues affecting digital campaigns or client accounts to ensure seamless operation.
4. Website Optimization & Data Integration
    ? Assist in website optimization efforts to improve user experience, speed, and SEO.
    ? Help implement and manage integrations between websites, apps, and CRM systems to streamline tracking and automation.
5. Project Management & Client Collaboration
    ? Support client proposal development, strategic documentation, and presentations.
    ? Organize project timelines and ensure that deliverables are met on schedule.
Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in IT, Marketing or a related field.
• 1-3 years of experience in digital marketing, specifically with Google and Meta Ads.
• Strong analytical skills and experience with data reporting.
• Familiarity with website builders (e.g., WordPress, Shopify) and CRM platforms.
• Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and communication skills.
• Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
Preferred Skills:
• Background or experience in IT or technical troubleshooting is a plus.
• Knowledge of HTML, CSS, or basic coding to support website-related troubleshooting.
• Familiarity with analytics and data visualization tools.

Why Join Us?

This role provides the opportunity to work across multiple facets of digital marketing, with exposure to both campaign management and technical support. You’ll join a collaborative team where your contributions are valued, and there’s room to grow your skills in a dynamic work environment.

Application Instructions:
All applicants must complete the following test: [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QKlCd7FIdobwex7ZlerOatRl3n7-L-j0d1jtsh_pSOM/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.r5j52gpzkapa]. Once done, email the completed test to hello@digitaldifferencemakers.com, with jerald@digitaldifferencemakers.com and david@digitaldifferencemakers.com CC'd. Please use the subject line: "DDM Operations Assistant Test Completed".

Note: Applicants who do not follow these instructions will not be considered.

title: Full stack Developer
description:
Job Title: Full Stack Developer (SaaS Marketplace Platform)
Location: Remote
Type: Full-Time
Salary: Competitive, based on experience

About Us:
TidyDen is a rapidly growing SaaS-based platform revolutionising household service management. Currently transitioning from a no-code platform to a fully coded solution, we aim to create a marketplace for household services, starting with cleaning and expanding into lawn care, gardening, pressure washing, and more. We’re passionate about building a platform that delivers exceptional customer experiences and empowers service providers.

Role Overview:
We are seeking an experienced Full Stack Developer to lead the redevelopment of our platform. You’ll be responsible for creating a high-performing, scalable solution, encompassing a web application and native mobile apps for Android and iOS. This is an opportunity to own the technical development of a platform from MVP to full-scale deployment, with significant input into architectural decisions and functionality.

Key Responsibilities:
- Platform Development: Redevelop the TidyDen platform from Bubble.io to a coded SaaS solution.
- Frontend Development: Create responsive, intuitive interfaces for web and mobile apps, leveraging the existing UI/UX design with minimal modifications.
- Backend Development: Build robust backend systems for user management, booking, payments, notifications, and reporting.
- API Integration: Integrate third-party services, including Stripe/AirWallex (payments), OnceHub (calendar), Google Maps API, and JustCall (SMS).
- Data Management: Design and maintain a secure database (Microsoft SQL) for efficient data storage and reporting.
- Feature Implementation: Develop key features such as referral programs, gift cards, cleaner ratings, in-app messaging, and more.
- Testing & Deployment: Implement automated and manual testing and CI/CD pipelines to ensure seamless deployments.
- Collaboration: Work closely with the founding team to align technical deliverables with business objectives.

Technical Skills Required:
- Proficiency in full stack development (Frontend: React/Angular/Vue; Backend: Node.js/Django/Rails).
- Strong experience with SQL databases (preferably Microsoft SQL).
- Expertise in building scalable web and mobile applications.
- Experience with integrating third-party APIs (e.g., Stripe, Google Maps).
- Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and deployment strategies.
- Familiarity with data security best practices (e.g., Australian Privacy Act compliance).

Experience:
- Proven track record of developing and launching SaaS platforms.
- Experience with marketplace platforms is highly desirable.
- Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.

Soft Skills:
- Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
- Excellent communication skills to collaborate with non-technical stakeholders.
- Self-motivated with the ability to manage time effectively in a remote environment.

What We Offer:
- The opportunity to lead the development of a platform with global ambitions.
- A collaborative and innovative work environment.
- Competitive salary with room for growth as the company scales.
- Flexible working arrangements.

title: Software Developer

Experience in developing KPI tracking tools or similar analytical platforms.

---

Submit your resume and portfolio with an introduction video saying Hi Quinn

title: AI Developor/Specialist
description:
We are a company focused on helping digital creators and entrepreneurs scale their businesses using automation, AI, and data-driven workflows. We’re looking for a highly skilled AI Workflow Automation Specialist who can design and implement robust workflows to scrape YouTube videos, generate long-form and short-form scripts, ad copy, website copy, and VSLs. The workflow must dynamically adapt to different niches based on onboarding data for multiple clients.

This is a critical role for building scalable, automated solutions that drive real impact for our clients.

Responsibilities

 • Workflow Design and Automation:
 • Create end-to-end workflows using tools like Make, Apify, Perplexity, and OpenAI to:
 • Scrape YouTube videos based on niche-specific keywords and filters (e.g., low-subscriber channels with high-view videos).
 • Automate the generation of:
 • Long-form and short-form content scripts.
 • Ad copy optimized for various platforms.
 • Website copy tailored to client needs.
 • Video Sales Letters (VSLs) with high conversion potential.
 • Dynamic Niche Switching:
 • Design workflows that adapt to different niches based on an onboarding sheet submitted by clients, pulling relevant data dynamically for each project.
 • Data Extraction and Filtering:
 • Use Apify and Perplexity to scrape and process data from YouTube and other platforms.
 • Implement advanced filtering mechanisms to identify high-performing videos from low-subscriber channels.
 • AI Integration:
 • Leverage OpenAI GPT-4 (or similar models) to generate high-quality, client-specific content.
 • Develop and optimize prompts to ensure generated content aligns with client goals and audience needs.
 • Workflow Optimization:
 • Continuously test and refine workflows to improve accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
 • Monitor workflow performance and ensure timely execution of tasks.
 • Collaboration and Communication:
 • Work closely with the team to align automation workflows with business objectives.
 • Provide regular updates on workflow progress and performance.

Qualifications

 • Technical Expertise:
 • Proficiency in Make (formerly Integromat) for building and managing complex workflows.
 • Experience with Apify for web scraping and data extraction.
 • Familiarity with Perplexity AI for advanced data queries and research.
 • Strong knowledge of OpenAI GPT-4 for content generation.
 • Content Automation Skills:
 • Proven experience in generating scripts for long-form and short-form content, ad copy, website copy, and VSLs using AI tools.
 • Ability to adapt content tone and style to various niches and client preferences.
 • Problem-Solving and Optimization:
 • Analytical skills to troubleshoot and resolve workflow issues.
 • Creative mindset to optimize workflows for different client needs and scaling demands.
 • Project Management:
 • Ability to manage multiple workflows simultaneously and meet deadlines.
 • Detail-oriented with a focus on delivering high-quality results.
 • Communication:
 • Strong written and verbal communication skills to explain technical concepts and processes clearly.
 • Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications

 • Experience in scaling content automation for businesses in the digital product or creator space.
 • Knowledge of YouTube Data API and advanced filtering techniques for identifying high-performing videos.
 • Familiarity with additional automation tools like Zapier, Airtable, or Pabbly Connect.
 • Understanding of SEO, digital marketing trends, and audience engagement strategies.

title: Senior Data Scraping Enginee
description:

Fully remote (Australian Generative AI startup)

Strong communication and collaboration skills.
